decks.notes: This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells, while also controlling the board with removal and disruption. The deck aims to quickly accelerate into its high-cost threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, while using cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return to control the opponent's board. The Eldrazi creatures provide a strong late-game presence, while the ramp spells and mana acceleration help ensure that the deck can cast its powerful spells ahead of schedule.

The deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a mix of creatures and burn spells, while also disrupting their game plan with hand disruption. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional ways to pump up your creatures and push for lethal damage. Chained to the Rocks and Goblin Bombardment offer additional removal options to control the board and secure victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans and control the game through the use of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By using cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Thought Scour, the deck aims to maintain control of the board while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. With a well-balanced land base and a focus on efficient card selection and disruption, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out victories through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts like Codex Shredder, Lantern of Insight, and Ensnaring Bridge to control the opponent's draws and prevent them from developing their board. With the help of cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize for disruption, the deck aims to lock the opponent out of the game while assembling the combo pieces necessary for victory. The inclusion of cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Extirpate further solidify the control aspect of the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to recover or mount a comeback.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider and Nourishing Shoal combo to cheat out big creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck uses cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to efficiently find and tutor the combo pieces. The inclusion of Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer protects the combo from disruption while Mox Amber provides additional mana acceleration. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Autochthon Wurm and Endurance for added resilience and flexibility in different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through spells like Faithless Looting, Deep Analysis, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides a win condition, while Kiora, the Rising Tide helps to ramp up mana. The mana base is designed to support all three colors of the Jeskai faction, ensuring that the deck has access to all the necessary spells to maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost spells and creatures. It uses cards like Mutagenic Growth and Lightning Bolt to chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The deck also benefits from the prowess ability of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pump up its damage output. With a mix of burn spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent by using various removal spells, discard spells, and creature removal. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through card advantage and efficient removal. The lands are carefully chosen to provide flexibility and consistency in casting spells.
